Anika Saima Tanisha

Journalism Student, Storyteller, and Photographer. Capturing the narratives that shape our world.

View My WorkContact Me

About Me

A curious and empathetic storyteller with a passion for truth and social awareness.

Interests & Personality
Reading classic literature, watercolor painting of Dhaka's daily life, experimenting with Bangladeshi recipes, and street photography focusing on human expressions. Highly curious, creative, empathetic, and observant.
Values & Philosophy
"Knowledge is meant to be shared, and kindness is its best expression. Stories connect us, and truth empowers us, especially for those whose voices are often unheard."
Favorite Quote
"The more I learn, the more I realize how much I don't know." - A reflection of her continuous quest for understanding.
Favorite Subjects
Investigative journalism (social justice), media ethics, digital storytelling, photojournalism, and cultural anthropology of urban Bangladesh.
Favorite Places
The dusty sections of Nilkhet book market, quiet tea stalls in Old Dhaka for observing life, and the vibrant chaos of Karwan Bazar wholesale market.
Community
Volunteers at Radio Shadhin 92.4 FM, promotes media literacy, and maintains a personal blog with photography and cultural essays.

Education

My academic journey in pursuit of knowledge and storytelling.

University of Dhaka
Bachelor of Arts in Journalism and Mass Communication | 2020 - 2026 (Expected)

Consistently maintaining a strong academic record (CGPA of 3.85/4.00). Major projects include an investigative report on urban waste management and a documentary on street vendors.

Holy Cross College, Dhaka
Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC), Humanities | 2018 - 2020

Achieved a GPA of 5.00 (Golden A+). Recognized for outstanding performance in English literature.

Viqarunnisa Noon School and College
Primary & Secondary School | 2007 - 2018

Key member of the school's debate club and a regular contributor to the school magazine, 'Shishu Barta', which sparked her interest in journalism.

Experience

Putting storytelling into practice through professional and volunteer work.

The Daily Star
Intern, City Desk
Summer 2023

Assisted senior journalists with fact-checking, conducted preliminary interviews, and contributed several published articles on community events.

Dhaka Kaleidoscope (Online Magazine)
Freelance Content Writer
2022 - Present

Writes engaging articles on various cultural topics, including traditional Bangladeshi arts, emerging music scenes, and local culinary traditions.

Radio Shadhin 92.4 FM
Volunteer
Community Engagement

Assists with program production, scriptwriting for PSAs, and reporting on local community events. Actively promotes media literacy.

Journalistic Philosophy

"I believe profoundly in the power of ethical, unbiased journalism to inform, challenge, and inspire positive societal change. I am committed to presenting balanced perspectives, giving voice to underrepresented communities, and holding power accountable through meticulous reporting."
